member.name: P:ComponentPro.Saml1.AttributeQuery.Resource
member.summary: Gets or sets the resource.
member.remarks: If present, specifies that the attribute query is being made in order to evaluate a specific access request relating to the resource. The SAML authority MAY use the resource attribute to establish the scope of the request. It is permitted for this attribute to have the value of the empty URI reference (""), and the meaning is defined to be "the start of the current document", as specified by [RFC 2396].

member.name: T:ComponentPro.Saml1.AudienceRestrictionCondition
member.summary: The AudienceRestrictionCondition element specifies that the assertion is addressed to one or more specific audiences identified by Audience elements. Although a SAML relying party that is outside the audiences specified is capable of drawing conclusions from an assertion, the SAML authority explicitly makes no representation as to accuracy or trustworthiness to such a party.

member.summary: The AuthorityBinding element MAY be used to indicate to a SAML relying party processing an that a SAML authority may be available to provide additional information about the subject of the statement. member.name: P:ComponentPro.Saml1.AuthorityBinding.Kind
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of SAML protocol _queries to which the authority described by this element will respond.
member.remarks: The value is specified as an XML Schema QName. The AuthorityKind value is either the QName of the desired SAML protocol query element or, in the case of an extension schema, the QName of the SAML QueryAbstractType complex type or some extension type that was derived from it. In the case of an extension schema, the authority will respond to all query elements of the specified type.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Saml1.AuthorityBinding.Location
member.summary: Gets or sets the URI reference describing how to locate and communicate with the authority.
member.remarks: the exact syntax of which depends on the protocol binding in use. For example, a binding based on HTTP will be a web URL, while a binding based on SMTP might use the mailto: scheme.

member.name: T:ComponentPro.Saml1.DoNotCacheCondition
member.summary: Indicates that the assertion SHOULD be used immediately by the relying party and MUST NOT be retained for future use. A SAML authority SHOULD NOT include more than one DoNotCacheCondition element within a Conditions element of an assertion.
member.remarks: Note that no Relying Party implementation is required to perform caching. However, any that do so MUST observe this condition. If multiple DoNotCacheCondition elements appear within a Conditions element, a Relying Party MUST treat the multiple elements as though a single DoNotCacheCondition element was specified. For the purposes of determining the validity of the Conditions element, the DoNotCacheCondition is considered to always be valid.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Saml1.Response.InResponseTo
member.summary: Gets or sets the reference to the identifier of the request to which the response corresponds.
member.remarks: If the response is not generated in response to a request, or if the RequestID attribute value of a request cannot be determined (because the request is malformed), then this attribute MUST NOT be present. Otherwise, it MUST be present and its value MUST match the value of the corresponding RequestID attribute value.

member.summary: Gets or sets the minor version of this response.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Saml1.Response.Recipient
member.summary: Gets or sets the intended recipient of this response.
member.remarks: This is useful to prevent malicious forwarding of responses to unintended recipients, a protection that is required by some use profiles. It is set by the generator of the response to a URI reference that identifies the intended recipient. If present, the actual recipient MUST check that the URI reference identifies the recipient or a resource managed by the recipient. If it does not, the response MUST be discarded.

member.summary: Gets or sets the identifier for the response.

member.name: T:ComponentPro.Saml2.Attribute
member.summary: The Attribute element identifies an attribute by name and optionally includes its value(s). It has the AttributeType complex type. It is used within an attribute statement to express particular attributes and values associated with an assertion subject. It is also used in an attribute query to request that the values of specific SAML attributes be returned.

member.name: T:ComponentPro.Saml2.AudienceRestriction
member.summary: The AudienceRestriction element specifies that the assertion is addressed to one or more specific audiences identified by Audience elements. Although a SAML relying party that is outside the audiences specified is capable of drawing conclusions from an assertion, the SAML asserting party explicitly makes no representation as to accuracy or trustworthiness to such a party.

member.remarks: The asymmetric key is used to decrypt the symmetric key contained within the encrypted data. The symmetric key is used to decrypt the data. The encryption method for the data is specified in the encrypted data or may be explicitly specified.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the EncryptedId class from a Name Idenfifier.
member.remarks: A random symmetric session key is generated from the public key contained within the X.509 certificate. The symmetric key is used to encrypt the data. The encryption method for the encrypted symmetric key is http://www.w3.org/2001/04/xmlenc#rsa-1_5. The specified data encryption method is used. For example, http://www.w3.org/2001/04/xmlenc#aes256-cbc.
member.param: The method for the data encryption.
The key info to include with the encrypted data.

member.name: T:ComponentPro.Saml2.Issuer
member.summary: Provides information about the issuer of a SAML assertion or protocol message. The element requires the use of a string to carry the issuer's name, but permits various pieces of descriptive data.

member.name: T:ComponentPro.Saml2.NameIdType
member.summary: Represents the NameIDType XML element.
member.remarks: The NameIDType complex type is used when an element serves to represent an entity by a string-valued name. It is a more restricted form of identifier than the BaseID element and is the type underlying both the NameID and Issuer elements.

member.summary: Initialize a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Initialize a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Initialize a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Updates the specified XML element.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Saml2.NameIdType.Format
member.summary: Gets or sets the URI reference representing the classification of string-based identifier information.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Saml2.NameIdType.NameIdentifier
member.summary: Gets or sets the name identifier.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Saml2.NameIdType.NameQualifier
member.summary: Gets or sets the security or administrative domain that qualifies the name.
member.remarks: This attribute provides a means to federate names from disparate user stores without collision.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Saml2.NameIdType.SpNameQualifier
member.summary: Gets or sets the SP name qualifier.
member.remarks: Further qualifies a name with the name of a service provider or affiliation of providers. This attribute provides an additional means to federate names on the basis of the relying party or parties.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Saml2.NameIdType.SpProvidedId
member.summary: Gets or sets the name identifier established by a service provider or affiliation of providers for the entity, if it is different from the primary name identifier given in the content of the element.
member.remarks: This attribute provides a means of integrating the use of SAML with existing identifiers already in use by a service provider.

member.summary: Closes the log writer.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Saml.Diagnostics.LogWriterBase.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Dispose(bool disposing) executes in two distinct scenarios. If disposing equals true, the method has been called directly or indirectly by a user's code. Managed and unmanaged resources can be disposed. If disposing equals false, the method has been called by the runtime from inside the finalizer and you should not reference other objects. Only unmanaged resources can be disposed.
member.param: If true, is called by IDisposable.Dispose. Otherwise it is called by finalizer.

member.name: T:ComponentPro.Saml.HttpCacheProvider
member.summary: Represents HTTP Cache provider.

member.name: T:ComponentPro.Saml.ISamlCacheProvider
member.summary: Defines generalized SAML cache provider.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Saml.ISamlCacheProvider.Add(System.String,System.Object,System.Web.Caching.CacheDependency,System.DateTime,System.TimeSpan,System.Web.Caching.CacheItemPriority,System.Web.Caching.CacheItemRemovedCallback)
member.summary: Adds the specified item to the System.Web.Caching.Cache object with dependencies, expiration and priority policies, and a delegate you can use to notify your application when the inserted item is removed from the Cache.
member.param: The cache key used to reference the item.
The item to be added to the cache.
The file or cache key dependencies for the item. When any dependency changes, the object becomes invalid and is removed from the cache. If there are no dependencies, this parameter contains null.
The time at which the added object expires and is removed from the cache. If you are using sliding expiration, the absoluteExpiration parameter must be System.Web.Caching.Cache.NoAbsoluteExpiration.

The interval between the time the added object was last accessed and the time at which that object expires. If this value is the equivalent of 20 minutes, the object expires and is removed from the cache 20 minutes after it is last accessed. If you are using absolute expiration, the slidingExpiration parameter must be System.Web.Caching.Cache.NoSlidingExpiration.

The relative cost of the object, as expressed by the System.Web.Caching.CacheItemPriority enumeration. The cache uses this value when it evicts objects; objects with a lower cost are removed from the cache before objects with a higher cost.
A delegate that, if provided, is called when an object is removed from the cache. You can use this to notify applications when their objects are deleted from the cache.
member.returns: An System.Object if the item was previously stored in the Cache; otherwise, null.
member.exception: The key or value parameter is set to null.
The slidingExpiration parameter is set to less than TimeSpan.Zero or more than one year.
The absoluteExpiration and slidingExpiration parameters are both set for the item you are trying to add to the Cache.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Saml.ISamlCacheProvider.Get(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves the specified item from the System.Web.Caching.Cache object.
member.param: The identifier for the cache item to retrieve.
member.returns: The retrieved cache item, or null if the key is not found.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Saml.ISamlCacheProvider.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Retrieves a dictionary enumerator used to iterate through the key settings and their values contained in the cache.
member.returns: An enumerator to iterate through the System.Web.Caching.Cache object.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Saml.ISamlCacheProvider.Remove(System.String)
member.summary: Removes the specified item from the application's System.Web.Caching.Cache object.
member.param: A System.String identifier for the cache item to remove.
member.returns: The item removed from the Cache. If the value in the key parameter is not found, returns null.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Saml.ISamlCacheProvider.Insert(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Inserts an item into the System.Web.Caching.Cache object with a cache key to reference its location, using default values provided by the System.Web.Caching.CacheItemPriority enumeration.
member.param: The cache key used to reference the item.
The object to be inserted into the cache.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Saml.ISamlCacheProvider.Insert(System.String,System.Object,System.Web.Caching.CacheDependency)
member.summary: Inserts an object into the System.Web.Caching.Cache that has file or key dependencies.
member.param: The cache key used to identify the item.
The object to be inserted in the cache.

The file or cache key dependencies for the inserted object. When any dependency changes, the object becomes invalid and is removed from the cache. If there are no dependencies, this parameter contains null.
member.exception: The key or value parameter is null.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Saml.ISamlCacheProvider.Insert(System.String,System.Object,System.Web.Caching.CacheDependency,System.DateTime,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Inserts an object into the System.Web.Caching.Cache with dependencies and expiration policies.
member.param: The cache key used to reference the object.
The object to be inserted in the cache.

The file or cache key dependencies for the inserted object. When any dependency changes, the object becomes invalid and is removed from the cache. If there are no dependencies, this parameter contains null.

The time at which the inserted object expires and is removed from the cache. To avoid possible issues with local time such as changes from standard time to daylight time, use System.DateTime.UtcNow rather than System.DateTime.Now for this parameter value. If you are using absolute expiration, the slidingExpiration parameter must be System.Web.Caching.Cache.NoSlidingExpiration.

The interval between the time the inserted object is last accessed and the time at which that object expires. If this value is the equivalent of 20 minutes, the object will expire and be removed from the cache 20 minutes after it was last accessed. If you are using sliding expiration, the absoluteExpiration parameter must be System.Web.Caching.Cache.NoAbsoluteExpiration.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Saml.ISamlCacheProvider.Insert(System.String,System.Object,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Inserts an object into the System.Web.Caching.Cache with dependencies and expiration policies.
member.param: The cache key used to reference the object.
The object to be inserted in the cache.

The interval between the time the inserted object is last accessed and the time at which that object expires. If this value is the equivalent of 20 minutes, the object will expire and be removed from the cache 20 minutes after it was last accessed. If you are using sliding expiration, the absoluteExpiration parameter must be System.Web.Caching.Cache.NoAbsoluteExpiration.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Saml.ISamlCacheProvider.Insert(System.String,System.Object,System.Web.Caching.CacheDependency,System.DateTime,System.TimeSpan,System.Web.Caching.CacheItemPriority,System.Web.Caching.CacheItemRemovedCallback)
member.summary: Inserts an object into the System.Web.Caching.Cache object with dependencies, expiration and priority policies, and a delegate you can use to notify your application when the inserted item is removed from the Cache.
member.param: The cache key used to reference the object.
The object to be inserted in the cache.
The file or cache key dependencies for the item. When any dependency changes, the object becomes invalid and is removed from the cache. If there are no dependencies, this parameter contains null.

The time at which the inserted object expires and is removed from the cache. To avoid possible issues with local time such as changes from standard time to daylight time, use System.DateTime.UtcNow rather than System.DateTime.Now for this parameter value. If you are using absolute expiration, the slidingExpiration parameter must be System.Web.Caching.Cache.NoSlidingExpiration.

The interval between the time the inserted object was last accessed and the time at which that object expires. If this value is the equivalent of 20 minutes, the object will expire and be removed from the cache 20 minutes after it was last accessed. If you are using sliding expiration, the absoluteExpiration parameter must be System.Web.Caching.Cache.NoAbsoluteExpiration.

The cost of the object relative to other items stored in the cache, as expressed by the System.Web.Caching.CacheItemPriority enumeration. This value is used by the cache when it evicts objects; objects with a lower cost are removed from the cache before objects with a higher cost.
A delegate that, if provided, will be called when an object is removed from the cache. You can use this to notify applications when their objects are deleted from the cache.

member.value: The number of items stored in the cache.

member.summary: Gets or sets the cache item at the specified key.

member.summary: Creates a byte array from the hexadecimal string. Each two characters are combined to create one byte. First two hexadecimal characters become first byte in returned array. Non-hexadecimal characters are ignored.

number of characters in string ignored
